{"id":1251372766,"question_id":2871,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1715050574,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1251372766/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Double a Number Represented as a Linked List","memory":"45.6 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * public class ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode next;\n *     ListNode() {}\n *     ListNode(int val) { this.val = val; }\n *     ListNode(int val, ListNode next) { this.val = val; this.next = next; }\n * }\n */\nclass Solution {\n    public ListNode doubleIt(ListNode head) {\n\n        if(head==null) return head;\n\n        ListNode rev = reverse(head);\n\n        int carry = 0;\n\n        ListNode prev = new ListNode();\n        ListNode curr = rev;\n        while(curr!=null){\n\n            int val = curr.val*2 + carry;\n            carry = val/10;\n            val %= 10;\n            curr.val = val;\n            prev = curr;\n            curr = curr.next;\n\n        }\n\n        if(carry!=0){\n            ListNode node = new ListNode(1);\n            prev.next = node;\n        }\n\n        return reverse(rev);\n            \n        \n        \n    }\n\n    private ListNode reverse(ListNode node){\n        ListNode prev = null;\n        while(node!=null){\n            ListNode next = node.next;\n            node.next = prev;\n            prev = node;\n            node = next;   \n        }\n\n        return prev;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"double-a-number-represented-as-a-linked-list","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
